goal.en:
This course is designed for third year students (and open to all other years as well) who plan to pursue graduate study in literature, cultural studies, film and media studies or related fields or are interested in challenging reading and writing assignments. The course has three objectives: 1) to familiarize students with the techniques of close reading and sharpen students’ interpretive skills in constructing their own sustained analysis of a literary and/or a media text; 2) to teach students how to develop their reading as a response to academic discussions about relevant cultural practices and social issues, a process that includes learning to search for, evaluate and incorporate relevant research material; 3) to guide students in the use of the Chicago format for writing academic papers. 

This is an advanced course which builds on the basic writing skills (such as exposition, writing about texts and across different media, documentation, and argumentation) and develop them in such a way that research will be able to engage with specific praxises, textual, creative, professional, media and interdisciplinary. To do so, the instructor will develop specific writing exercises, themes and cases.

outline.ch:
1. 學生出席率要求為 90％，出席不足者，全期成績有可能降低或評為不合格。
2. 學生應準時出席，遲到 10分鐘即算缺席;上課應遵守課堂守則。
3. 學生需要依時遞交作業，遲交即扣分。限期一星期後遞交的所有作業，老師有權評為零分。
4. 所有作業的引用部份或參考內容，以及以人工智能協助的部份，必需清楚列出，否則會視為抄襲處理。本課強調參考文獻、誠信、準確性和來源驗證。AI 或 ChatGPT 應被用作輔助工具之一，如計算機或百科全書一樣，主要用於增強對課程的理解，而不是寫作工具。如被發現過度依賴AI完成作業，可被評為不合格。
5. 學生平日需要注意電郵及eeclass通訊，以獲取本課資訊。
outline.en:
Topics to be explored include the institutional aspects of thesis writing, the structure of research, the problem of plagiarism, critical reading and writing, and format and documentation. Homework assignments consist of oral reports and written reports. The course sees writing as a process, so rewriting is required. At the end of the class, each student should submit a well-prepared academic paper (double spaced, 10-page) that involves framing and tackling independent research questions.
Specific content:
Representation and Media Analysis
Textual Analysis and close reading
Participatory Action Research
Creative Research
Citation and references

gradMethod.ch: 本課的成績評核分為三個部分，包括上課討論及課上報告、課堂練習及寫作、期中及期末報告。 要於本課合格，你必需繳交所有作業。缺課兩次或欠繳作業兩次者建議退選。
gradMethod.en:
1. Course attendance ＆ weekly written exercises and presentations: 35％
Students are expected (i) to attend class weekly, and (ii) to engage and participate actively in discussion and do each weekly presentation and written research exercise.
2.  Draft assignments: 30％
3. Final research report assignment: 35％
Attendance is mandatory. If you miss more than two class meetings or more than two assignments, you will be advised to withdraw. Not turning in assignments is grounds for failing the class, as is plagiarism. 
Students will be graded on weekly reading assignments, the final research paper and preliminary drafts, and lively class participation. Preliminary rewriting (and rethinking) will be done in class workshops. No late papers will be accepted.
